headline: Ares Management Stock Falls as Q4 Earnings Miss, Expenses Rise Y/Y
summary: ARES stock dips nearly 7.3% as Q4 earnings miss estimates due to higher expenses. Nevertheless, growth in assets under management offers some support.

headline: Why the software stock sell-off may be bad news for private credit
summary: The sell-off in software stocks could impact far more than just investor portfolios. Its ripple effects could impact private credit companies, too. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter David Hollerith explains. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Blackstone gets India's central bank nod to buy Federal Bank stake
summary: Feb 5 (Reuters) - The Indian central bank has approved private equity firm Blackstone's acquisition of up to a 9.99% stake in Federal Bank, the private lender said on Thursday.

raw.headline: Blackstone gets India's central bank nod to buy Federal Bank stake
raw.summary: Feb 5 (Reuters) - The Indian central bank has approved private equity firm Blackstone's acquisition of up to a 9.99% stake in Federal Bank, the private lender said on Thursday.

headline: Ares Management: Bonds Offer Interesting 7.0% Plus Yields

headline: Private Credit Giants Back A$1.4 Billion BGH Loan for Aspen Asia Deal
summary: Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Blackstone and Apollo are set to fund covenant-lite financing for BGH's acquisition of Aspen Pharmacare's Asia Pacific operations.

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Blackstone’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Blackstone’s fourth quarter results reflected contrasting trends, as revenue surpassed Wall Street’s expectations but profit missed consensus estimates. Management attributed the top-line growth to strong inflows across institutional, private wealth, and insurance channels, as well as robust investment performance in infrastructure and private equity. However, higher costs and a less favorable fee mix weighed on earnings, with CFO Michael Chae noting, “Base management fees in real estate decline
